news_header: Opium cultivation in Afghanistan has increased by 19% this year despite Taliban restrictions.
news_text: According to the UNODC, opium cultivation in Afghanistan has risen by 19% this year. The Taliban has nearly banned cultivation, which was at 232,000 hectares when the ban was implemented in April 2022. The center of opium cultivation has shifted to the northeastern province, moving away from Taliban strongholds in the south.
